data.title: Other Royal and Noble Weddings
data.meta_description:
Princess Xenia zu Hohenlohe-Langenburg (*1972) married Max Soltmann at the Statdtkirche zum Heiligen Blut (in Langenburg), last August 26th.
The bride is...
data.text:
Elsa M. said:

Princess Xenia zu Hohenlohe-Langenburg (*1972) married Max Soltmann at the Statdtkirche zum Heiligen Blut (in Langenburg), last August 26th.

The bride is the daughter of late Fürst Kraft zu Hohenlohe-Langenburg and of Princess Charlotte von Croÿ. She arrived in the church escorted by her eldest brother, the present Fürst zu Hohenlohe-Langenburg.

What a beautiful tiara. Can anyone tell me more about it?

The Dukes of Bedford

Can anyone please provide photos of the weddings of the 13th, 14th , 15th Dukes of Bedford and also of the Bedford sons Lordy Robin Russell and his younger brother James. The 14th Earl is Robin who married Henrietta Tiarks, and the 15th is Andrew who married Louise Crammer(?)

I do hope that someone can help.

jahagz said:

Is there any news on when the Duke of Huescar will be marrying? She's quite wealthy, no?​

There is no official news, the wedding at the moment is a rumor. The marriage of the Duke of Huescar with his first wife, Matil Solis, already has been annulled by the Church, so it will be necessary to wait. Probably if there is wedding, this one will be discreet.

His current couple is Alicia Koplowitz, Marquise of Bellavista, one of the richest women of Spain together with her sister Esther. She also is divorced of her first husband.

Alicia Koplowitz

http://estaticos02.cache.el-mundo.net/elmundo/fotos_gente/2006/11/24/1164391764_extras_fotos_gente_1.jpg

Hannelore said:

The couple had 5 children:

- Princess Cristina (married to Pedro Lopez-Quesada): photo can be found here http://www.theroyalforums.com/forums/411463-post16.html

- Princess Maria (married to archduke Simeon of Austria): wedding thread can be found here (+ a photo of princess Cristina's wedding) http://www.theroyalforums.com/forums/f31/archduke-simeon-von-habsburg-princess-maria-de-borbon-dos-sicilias-1996-a-6802.html?highlight=simeon ... same veil as her mother.

- Prince Pedro (married to Sofía Landaluce)

- Princess Inès (married to Michele Carelli Palombi): wedding thread can be found here: http://www.theroyalforums.com/forums/f31/princess-ines-de-borbon-dos-sicilias-michele-carrelli-2001-a-7660.html

- Princess Victoria (married to Markos Nomikos) : wedding thread can be found here: http://www.theroyalforums.com/forums/f31/princess-victoria-de-borbon-dos-sicilias-markos-nomikos-2003-a-4571.html?highlight=nomikos ... Victoria wore the same veil as her mother.

... and if I'm not mistaken they now have 11 grandchildren.

A small update:

Cristina has two children: a daughter Victoria (1997) and a son Pedro (2003).

Maria has five chlidren: Three sons Johannes (1997) Ludwig (1998) and Philipp (2007) and two daughters Isabel (2000) and Carlotta (2003).

Pedro has three children: Three sons Jaime (1997) Juan (2003) and Pablo (2004).

Ines has two children: Two daughters Teresa (2003) and Blanca (2005)

Victoria has two children: a son Anastasios (2005) and a daughter Ana (2006).

The religious ceremony took place at the Église Saint Bruno de Voiron, in the French Alpes. Besides the members of the Austrian imperial family, the wedding was also attended by Princess Astrid and Prince Lorenz of Belgium with their children, as well as by Prince Guillaume and Princess Sibilla of Luxembourg.

Here is a video with a short report (if needed, select the newscast from Samedi 02 Juin):

L'édition régionale des Alpes

The groom is a son of Archduke Rudolf of Austria and of his wife, née Baroness Hélène de Villenfagne de Vogelsanck. The bride is related to monseigneur Thierry Brac de la Perrière, auxiliary bishop of Lyon.

leonardinha said:

Neither do I, BurberryBrit... It's not fit for a royal bride, IMHO.

I wouldn't go that far. I just don't like the sleeves. I've seen worse on other royal brides (the bow disaster dress in the Netherlands for example).

Archduke Carl-Christian of Austria married Estelle de St. Romaine, on June 2nd 2007:

http://gekroondehoofden.web-log.nl/gekroondehoofden/2007/06/huwelijk_aartsh.html

I didn't like her dress at all. Hopefully more pics will emerge.

I don't like the top of her dress and her tiara, that isn't really the style I like, I love the bottem of her dress and her veil.

Personally, I don't like her gloves.

I don't like the top of her dress and her tiara, that isn't really the style I like, I love the bottem of her dress and her veil.

Oh, I see more pics were added since I posted the link! aving a better look, I don't like her gloves either. I think it's the length that is unflattering. Now that I can see the full gown, the sleeves aren't bad, but would look better without those gloves. Still, pretty bride and nice looking couple. Did I spot Amadeo de Belgique in a photo?

Oh, I see more pics were added since I posted the link! aving a better look, I don't like her gloves either. I think it's the length that is unflattering. Now that I can see the full gown, the sleeves aren't bad, but would look better without those gloves. Still, pretty bride and nice looking couple. Did I spot Amadeo de Belgique in a photo?

Those are the pictures from pvd, and yes you did

Prince Alexander of Yugoslavia & Princess Maria da Glória Orleães e Bragança 1972

Crown Prince Alexander of Yugoslavia (*1945) married Princess Maria da Glória de Orleães e Bragança (*1946), on July 1st, 1972, in Villamanrique de la Condesa (near Seville, Spain).

The couple had three sons (Hereditary Prince Peter and twins Philip and Alexander), but the marriage ended in divorced, in 1985.

The groom is the only child of Yugoslavia's last king, Peter II, and of his wife, Princess Alexandra of Greece and Denmark. By marrying a Roman Catholic, Alexander lost his place in the succesion line to the British Throne.

The bride is the daughter of Prince Pedro Gastão de Orleães e Bragança (the head of the Petrópolis branch of the Brazilian Imperial House) and of Princess Maria Esperanza de Borbón Dos-Sicilias, what makes her cousin of King Juan Carlos of Spain.

http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v666/daan73/firstweddingtoPrssMariadaGloriad-1.jpg

http://i17.photobucket.com/albums/b...todoPrncipeHerdeiroAlexandre.jpg?t=1176480634

Princess Maria Elisabetta Zellinger de Balkany & Olivier Janssens 2003

Princess Maria Elisabetta Zellinger de Balkany (*1972) married the Belgian Olivier Janssens (*1964) on June 17th 2003, at the Gothic church of Saint Mesme (near Versailles), where the father of the bride owns a castle. The civil wedding took place in Chene-Bourg (near Genève), on October 31st 2002.

The bride is the only daughter of Princess Maria Gabriella di Savoia and of her former husband, Robert Zellinger de Balkany.

The couple lives in Thailand (where Oliver manages a famous Coffee Company) and has now two children: Gabriella Luisa (*2004) and Tommaso (*2006).

From Point de Vue:

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x63/belerma/ElisabethBalkanybride.jpg

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x63/belerma/ElisabethBalkanygroom.jpg

More photos can be found here:

Worldroots.com

Count Bruno von Limburg-Stirum & Countess Christine de Lannoy 1995

Count Bruno von Limburg-Stirum (*1966) married Countess Christine de Lannoy (*1967), on June 17th, 1995. The ceremony took place at the Chateau d’Huldenberg (Belgium).

The groom is a son of Count Evrad von Limburg-Stirum and of his wife, née Princess Hélène d’Orléans. The bride is a daughter of the late Count Albert de Lannoy and of his wife, née Chantal t'Serstevens.

The couple has now 4 children: Gaspard (*1996), Felix (*1998), Achille (*2001) and Rose (*2003).

Photos from Point de Vue:

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x63/belerma/LimburgStrum4.jpg

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x63/belerma/LimburgStrum2.jpg

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x63/belerma/LimburgStrum3.jpg

http://i180.photobucket.com/albums/x63/belerma/LimburgStrum1.jpg

Duchess Mathilde von Würtemberg & Hereditary Count Erich von Waldburg zu Zeil 1988

Duchess Mathilde von Würtemberg (*1962) married Erbgraf Erich von Waldburg zu Zeil und Trauchburg (*1962), in 1988. The civil wedding took place in the Altshausen, on November 17th, while the religious ceremony happened on November 19th.

The bride is the eldest daughter of Duke Carl von Würtemberg and of his wife, née Princess Diane d'Orléans. The groom is the son of Princess Gabriele von Bayern and Fürst Georg von Waldburg zu Zeil und Trauchburg.

The couple has now 4 daughters: Marie-Thérèse (*1989), Marie Elisabeth (*1990), Marie Charlotte (*1992) and Marie Hélène (*1993).

Photos from Point de Vue:

Duchess Mathilde von Würtemberg (*1962) married Erbgraf Erich von Waldburg zu Zeil und Trauchburg (*1962), in 1988. The civil wedding took place in the Altshausen, on November 17th, while the religious ceremony happened on November 19th.

The bride is the eldest daughter of Duke Carl von Würtemberg and of his wife, née Princess Diane d'Orléans. The groom is the son of Princess Gabriele von Bayern and Fürst Georg von Waldburg zu Zeil und Trauchburg.

The couple has now 4 daughters: Marie-Thérèse (*1989), Marie Elisabeth (*1990), Marie Charlotte (*1992) and Marie Hélène (*1993).

They have a fifth daughter Marie-Gabrielle, (* 1996)
